Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved bands with pairs of dilute lines alternating with black bands; exterior: handle zone reserved with band at top; wall glazed with top of reserved band at break.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.620 and 1965,0930.625. Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this cup, the profile and decoration finds parallels to his Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.588) (Phase 3)
